page.title: 08ANTIQUITIES
page.content: There are several{antiquities}in the area.Antiquities are{stone structures} or{ancient villages}and{buildings which were made in the{Stone Age.} {TUMULUS}(714,216)and(716,217) These are Stone Age{mound tombs.}They are made of local stone and covered by mounds of earth.An{important person } would have been{burried}inside and then the entrance covered. {FOGOU}(714, 239) A fogou is a{passage}or{room}usually built underground but may be built above ground and covered with soil. They are made with walls of granite and large slabs of granite making the roof.Some people say they were {larders.} {STANDING STONES}(71,21) These are found on{Goonhilly Downs. } It is thought they marked{Parish } {boundaries. }
